page.title: 18GOLDINGTON GREEN
page.content: Goldington was once a village and now forms part of the town of Bedford. Goldington has a large open space which is called the "The Green".This area of common land has the main A428 east west trunk road crossing its southern boundary. Our school lies to the south of this road and it is called Goldington Green Lower School, it was first built in 1865. The road that follows the western and northern edge of the Green is called Church Lane. To the north can be found the public house called Goldington Hall parts of which date from the seventeenth century. Today the Green is used for many recreational activities by the local people.
